text: If mod_deflate's output filters are passed an empty brigade, they will pass the empty brigade to the next filter in the chain.  This is contrary to what is recommended by the "Guide to writing output filters" on the httpd website <http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/developer/output-filters.html>.  According to that page, empty brigades should be suppressed; upon seeing an empty brigade, the filter should simply return APR_SUCCESS rather than calling ap_pass_brigade.  This would be a trivial (2-line) change to mod_deflate.
creator: mdsteele@google.com
